reviews.review_msg: Old ratings are inaccurate. Garth's aware this class sucks and makes sure no one is confused and gives time for students to ask questions. Only had to use excel where we were shown exactly what was expected on the hw. The final was the only hard part.

For a statistics prof, Garth is AMAZING! He genuinely wants u to understand the material and will explain any concept to u until it makes sense. Sara (TA) is always willing to make sure u do well on assignments. Overall, the course is a lot of information but they make it easier. CRIM320 was SO much easier than STATS 100 because of their teaching!

Garth really tries to support his students in every way he can, the TA is phenomenal especially if you need extra help in understanding. The course itself is what is hard, Garth has it structured it so you are equally graded on grade boosters such as short quizzes and assignments rather than just weighted on exams

Super chill guy, do not read the old reviews, he is so cool and genuinely fun to listen to. Amazing lectures and clear guidelines for everything. If you put in the bare minimum amount of work, you will still get a really good grade.

Stay far away from CRIM 413 online if you care about your gpa. Hours of readings every week which can be very dense at times. Weekly discussion posts also take hours. Assignments are graded incredibly vaguely and have no rubric. Cherry on top is a closed book final based on 12 weeks of readings and videos where you write 4 essays in 3 hours.

Garth is an amazing prof, I had him for crim 413 with TA Mackenzie. Garth has interesting lectures, the content is fascinating, and the assignments I enjoyed doing. The class has a midterm and final, if you study and put in the time is not bad. I get reviews that are 50/50, but if you are interested in national security the class is awesome.

Finishing the CRIM 320 final exam, being the last exam of your entire degree feels like this:
*Frodo gazing out into Mordor with tears in his eyes* - "Its done".
*Sam turns to look at Frodo* - "Yes, Mr. Frodo, its over now".
If you take this class online you get to see pre recorded lectures from 2017 in which Garth hard beefs with an Asian kid all semester long. It's so funny makes up for how boring the class is.

Every crim major fears 320 but 321 was way worse IMO. I took this class as distance ed, and we watched pre recorded lecture material from 2017. Midterm was hard and they expected a lot but to be fair Garth does warn you. As long as you watch the lectures and labs you should get a B at least. Garth is super funny and has old school mentality.

You will go into the midterm thinking you are confident in the material, only to get absolutely destroyed. In the pre-recorded lecture from 2017, the class avg for the midterm was 55%. You could understand the assignments and quizzes and get high marks on those, only to somehow get wrecked on the midterm. Overall unclear expectations for the exam.

Not sure why this class has such a bad rep, its not nearly as bad as CRIM 321, perhaps someone got confused between the two when they started the fear bandwagon. Last semester before graduating and this is probably the only class I've taken where I feel like what I am learning is a job-ready skill. Its not terrible but you have to put in the work.

Four weeks in and I would rather walk 8 miles barefoot on lego bricks than have to take this class again.  Do NOT take this class remotely. It is a stats class and you WILL have questions or need help; if you need help you have to send the TA an email and wait 2-3 business days for a vague response that doesn't answer your question. I'm lovin' it!
Honestly one of the best classes I've ever taken. He is super knowledgeable about the subject and really involves the class, in a nice, non-pressuring way.

I took CRIM413 with Professor Davies and I was a little scared from the past reviews but this class was one of my favourite that I have taken at SFU so far! He is an amazing lecturer and makes lectures so fun and engaging. Exams are fair but you will need to do readings and keep up with lecture notes. I highly recommend this class :)

Overall, the course content was interesting. I enjoyed the lectures, and Garth seems like a solid dude. However the amount of readings required really put me off. The exams seemed fair, however an essay format I felt is not the best way to test a student's knowledge of a subject.

Very interesting class. Talked about world events as they occurred in real-time. Talked about the trucker protest in Ottawa, Afghanistan after the US withdrawal, Russia's invasion of Ukraine, and more. I highly recommend this class if it is available.

I was hesitant to take this class after 413 online, but this class was completely different. I highly recommend 423. The 4 briefing note assignments and short presentation (based off one briefing note) are not hard and can be completed within the first few weeks.  Then all you have to do is participate in class for the rest of the semester.

It is a tough course and exams are heavy for sure but Garth is always trying to be there to help you to succeed. He answers every question in class to make sure everyone is on track and he replies to emails frequently with clear instructions. Always be patient. It is absolutely worth taking classes with him.

Exams are tough for sure but hes an awesome lecturer! Super engaging, explains content well, and always happy to answer even the most basic questions multiple times. Take labs with Sara if shes one of the TAs, shes great as well!

Content is easy and assignments are easy too so to make the course more difficult they grade you on punctuation and APA. If you miss 2 commas/place them incorrectly, you wont get full marks on assignments. They are incredibly nitpicky but you wont know it until its too late to drop the course because it will initially seem like a very chill class.

This semester was brutal. The TM was extremely picky and would take off the most marks on citations and formatting. The final exam criteria is vague: cumulative exam with 12 weeks worth of content, a bunch of readings and videos in each module as well as the expectation for you to write 4 essays (2-4 pages double spaced) for each essay in 3 hours.

The previous ratings seem off. There are more readings than a "normal class" because there are no lectures. The material is a mix of videos and readings, which are all very engaging and current. The 4 essays were straightforward (only 3 1/2 pages)... you just need to write a good critical analysis. Can't understand the complaints. TM was great.

Tutor marker was particularly brutal this semester, maybe it was the prof, who knows. Nevertheless this class had so much potential. The content was interesting but the delivery was horrible. Never take this class online. Final exam is 4 essay Q's closed book covering 13 weeks of content, very vague in terms of what to expect, unfair marking.
Ridiculous amounts of rating, vague instructions, no guidance throughout the course. You will spend hours working on assignments and readings. Do not recommend at all. Stay away from this course.

I agree with all of the previous reviews so far. Way too many readings, unfair marking, unclear expectations. The cherry on the cake is finding out a week ago that our final exam will be five essay questions based off of everything in the course so far. Oh and before I forget, the exam is CLOSED BOOK, yet it is an online distance ed class. Smh

Never take 413 distance Ed. All I can say is - I would take 320 with him a dozen times over if it meant I didnt have to so much as think of terrorism again. What a mess of a class. Garth is an engaging lecturer (320) but his 413 distance ed class SUCKS

Easily the worst class I've ever taken at SFU. Took this class online and there are an insane amount of readings each week. The TA marks very hard and takes off A LOT of marks for things like grammar/ APA style. There has also been 0 direction, feedback or guidelines for what is expected on assignments. Horrible class, horrible prof, horrible TA.

Took this course online and it was a mistake. The course material is interesting, but 100+ pgs of reading every week is ridiculous. The T.M.'s marking is super tough. The weekly discussion posts/responses are brutal and marked hard. The short assignments are ok, but are marked more on grammar/ APA citation. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY!

This class has so much potential but instead most of the semester has gone by and I feel like I've learned nothing. They mark more on APA skills rather than actual writing/interpretation. The half dozen weekly dry readings/videos are a bore, condensing material would be better for learning purposes. Do not recommend.

If I had known what this class was going to be like, I wouldn't have been so bummed that I couldn't get into this class off the wait list for the past 2 years: Class is dry and feels like a poli sci class; lack of clear guidelines for what is to be learned from readings; WAY too many readings per week; TA marks unfair. Overall, disappointed.

Rather than using a textbook, students are inundated with weekly readings within the modules, many of which are unrelated to the specific module topic; overall feels like a poli-sci class; interesting material but WAY too many readings per week, like seriously. Rather than 100+ pages of rambling nonsense, please consider concise reading material.

The worst class I've ever taken at SFU. Vague lectures based on 100's of pages of readings. Expects the same level of knowledge he has on the subject. Failing average on the midterm with little to no review for either the midterm or exam in tutorial or clarification by the TA. Take this class if you want to cry.

PT. 1 okay, lets start by saying he yelled at our class for getting an average of 55%. Okay, understatement, HE YELLED AT US, LIKE MY DAD YELLED AT ME WHEN I WAS 5. "ITS IRONIC YOU GUYS ARE TALKING RIGHT NOW" referring to out midterm marks (Garth, lecture on October 24). He blamed us for the bad midterm, but they took off petty marks.
Hes super rude which he think probably thinks comes off as powerful but it is truly just unprofessional.

I'm not strong in stats AT ALL. I failed the first midterm, and was doing borderline in the class. Got a tutor, and saw him to discuss my options well before the 2nd midterm. When he says to do this, DO IT. Garth cares and IF YOU ARE WILLING TO PUT THE EFFORT IN, he'll help you. Plus, he usually has awesome socks which helps with his rude attitude

Great professor and awesome human being. A couple of semesters ago had a family tragedy and Garth supported and accommodated my situation. Overally very interesting to listen to, if you like Garth then also take Terrorism with him, his knowledge blew me away. He is the reason I decided to major in Criminology.

Garth was an amazing prof that makes lectures more bearable and interesting thanks to his funny sense of humor. Without his humor and knowledge, the class would be much harder. However, be prepared to put in the work because there are a lot of homework and the exams are not easy and this is one of the hardest classes in Crim so don't slack off.

(pt. 3) honestly taken a huge toll on me but by Garth giving me the chance to finish up this exam prompted me to turn around his reviews because in my opinion, the character of a professor really means a lot in the long run.

This class is already so hard specially for us crim students with limited stats knowledge and skills. He makes it harder by grading tough and placing a high emphasis on exams that half the class will fail. This class literally made me reconsider my degree. It was so damn hard and stressful.

Garth comes off very rude, and will spend 20 minutes of the first lecture complaining about late-comers but he will come late almost every class. Lecture slides consist of the bare minimum - have to type very fast to catch what he says. Avrg on midterm was a failing mark, however allowed a cheat sheet for final to even out the low class avrg

Great prof, easily top 3! Had him Crim 413 and 417 and must say he was one of the best lecturers and overall great individual! The exams consist of broad questions that if you went to lecture, you would know roughly what would be asked. Super helpful during office hours and very encouraging. Just don't be rude to him, and everything will be A Ok.

He has a fairly gruff attitude, has a rough sense of humor and comes off pretty harsh on some people, but his lectures are great, and the class is always fun. The exams require a lot of work, but they only have 3-5 essay questions, and each is basically a summary of a lecture. Its a tough course but one of the most interesting in the program.

Engaging, humorous (goes off on tangents), and always presents relevant information. Might appear intimidating, but he's actually a nice guy deep down. Don't skip lectures cause they're awesome. Same for tutorials. Lots of weight on the exams so make sure you're prepared to study literally everything and regurgitate everything!

Favorite prof at SFU hands down. His exams are hard and he makes you work for your grades. However, I learnt more than I even thought possible in one class. Love his passion and he is absolutely hilarious. Would take this class many times over - there isn't enough time to learn all he knows. He is extremely knowledgable far beyond terrorism.

Makes an already tough topic for most even tougher with tough grading. You will think you're doing well based on his in-class examples and tutorial homework but come the midterm and final, you will get destroyed. Do not take this class with him expecting to get anywhere near half-decent grades.

Really insightful class and interesting topic. Lots of readings and participation. Do not take this course if you are concerned about your grades though. Really tough marking and tests are tough even if you study a lot. He is also pretty discouraging and tends to put the class down about marks.

LOVE this prof. Incredibly knowledgeable about terrorism. Huge amount of readings (but I've had similar amounts, or even more, in other classes). Readings very on-point. Encourages participation. You MUST study weekly, to do well on the exams.
He studies terrorism for 40 years and expects you to be on the same knowledge level after a 2 hour lecture.

Garth is discouraging and I feel like he doesn't care about the success of his students. This was my favourite course to learn about yet i was constantly discouraged every week by the TA's remarks and Garth's doom and gloom personality. I wouldn't ever take a class with him again.

Garth is my favourite prof that I've ever had at SFU. Although the course was extremely hard, and he has incredibly high expectations, his lectures are so interesting. He is extremely passionate about the subject, you will never fall asleep in his class, and he encourages participation in his lectures. Favourite class thus far!

2nd class I have taken with Garth and same results. I got a B- the course is diffcuilt but he makes sure everyone understands. If you don't go to his office hours and he will help you. Ya hes loud and arrogant in class but hey the guy knows how to teach and help students and I respect that. He expects you to be a student hes old school!

Garth is passionate about what he teaches. I found Garth motivating and inspiring. I wish I had taken classes with Garth earlier (I took my first class with him during my final semester). Like most classes if you do well you tend to like the class. Do the work with Garth and you will hopefully enjoy the class.

Explained concepts well and would go over until it was understood. HOWEVER: extremely arrogant, condescending, complained about his job to students every lecture. Made class extremely uncomfortable, got very angry when students emailed him or asked questions outside of class. Ridiculed students in front of entire class for asking a simple question.

Took this class at Harbour Center with a group of about 30 students. You'll come to realize that he's a good prof that tries to help you understand those concepts. He cared more and was more pleasant in this small class. Forget the text, and study from lecture notes.

garth is a condescending, unhelpful prof. he hates it when students e-mail him and responses back with harsh answers. extremely hard exams, assignments and on the spot quizzes. this class will leave you stressed out and worried. very little help, sympathy and understanding from garth and the TAs. terribly laid out course structure. NOT RECOMMENDED

Garth is clear in his concepts. I wish he was more clear with regards to exam expectations. So much writing and you must know every single detail! This isn't an easy class and Garth tries to make it interesting, so there is that.

A difficult prof yes, but not to the point where one cannot pass with a descent grade. Exams were al written and very difficult to follow at times. Other than that Garth is great, this would be the second time I have taken him, never disappoints during lectures. Be ready to read and memorize online readings.

Garth appears intimidating but this is definitely one of my favourite classes ever at SFU! It is not easy but it is very interesting - I never zoned out in lecture. If you take detailed notes in lecture while he is speaking and attend all tutorials - you can do well. Also do the readings because you need to cite articles on the midterm and final.

Avoid!!!!! He has this stupid rule where you are not allowed to talk to him or the TA before,during or after class. The average for the midterm was 46 Percent and he blamed all the students on why we did so bad. Sorry to say but if out of 300 students the average is a fail thats on you as a teacher. The Ta wasnt much help marks way to hard.

Has strangest rule that any teacher can employ..not to talk to him at the beginning/break/end of class, yet when he tries to explain statistics (which is tough) he recommends that you see him during his office hours. Which never has appts. Exams are tough, no MC, all written and ridiculous Q's. Class average midterm: 51%. Take at your own risk.

Love that Garth will actually take the time to go over a concept as many times as needed until everyone understands it. He is intimidating at first, and won't treat you like you are in highschool. He treats everyone as an adult and expects that you work hard. Take his criticisms constructively and you will do well.

May seem intimidating at first but one of the best profs i have had. Drills the concept into your head and makes sure everyone understands before he moves on. Study his lecture notes inside out pay attention during lectures and you will know what is on the exam. The TA Rebecca is very helpful as well.

He is one of the most interesting professors to lecture.  He reminds me of some prior business professors who hand picked students to respond to questions and some walked away crying... He will challenge what you currently know, and does pick on people, but covers all perspectives so don't feel isolated.  His midterm was difficult and final ok

Intimidating at first, but really wants his students to understand. Very clear and straightforward. Fair marker. Loved that we did not have to do a research paper. SPSS was pretty easy if you went to tutorial. I liked his class, I don't know why people freak out so much.
He is a really good professor, he knows exactly what he is talking about. His class opened up my eyes about criminology/terrorism. He may have a really hard midterm, but his final was much easier!
First off really hard class, marks really hard. However, best lecturer I've ever had. Despite course difficulty this was probably my favorite criminology course..period.

I was worried about the class because of all the reviews here.  But he's a really good prof and always trying to clarify things. If you don't ask for clarification he can't help you.  He gives you hints to what will be on the exams. The TA, Rebecca, is really good and is also helpful in clarifying things.

There are lots of readings that, at times, can be quite dense but they are thought provoking. Garth has a reputation of being a "jerk" but no other professor has made me think more critically or "outside the box" than him. Yes he can be intimidating but he is by far one of the most approachable and caring professors I have ever had. Recommended.

AVOID GARTH AT ALL EXPENSES. class average on midterm was 17/35!?!? expects way too much from students for an elective. Lectures are long and boring and include way too much info. This class with Garth was more of a history class. definitely a GPA dropper. he is knowledgeable but arrogant.

Theres always the one person who thinks they want to be the teachers pet!! This class will leave you stressed and confused!! Be prepared to hire a tutor, without one you will FAIL this class!!! Be warned, exams are brutal!!

Do not take this class with Garth. This class is very difficult and SPSS doesn't make it any better. This class will leave you paranoid and sweating until the final exam. Class material is taught in a way to make it more difficult than it actually is. You will definitely need a tutor for this class. People in the class are annoying to top it off.
2 words: WACK JOB!

Honestly I don't think this guy should be teaching. He makes the class way harder than it really needs to be. What a waste of money. He brings SFU to a new low. The best advice I can give anyone is to not take him.
not involved

Worst class ever, Hardest exam. lowest average. No consideration about how the over all marks were distributed. He basically has pride in making this a hard class that the majority of people will not get a good grade it.

Garth made the class as painless as possible. He's excellent at clarifying confusions, but you've got to be willing to ask questions. TAs weren't as useful as they could have been as the tutorial and lectures were completely unrelated. All exams purely based on lectures and there's no text for lecture material. Overall, okay class if you try.

Good prof, but Im reading his courseware right now for another class, and I knew from crim 251 that he's a **** when it comes to picking hard readings, but He always made up with good teaching. Now, taking an online course with JUST HIS READINGS i have felt the extensive ****ness of his picks for readings...Good prof, horrible reading selection

The best lecturer/teacher I've ever had! He is attentive, genuinely cares for his students, accommodating, smart, and helpful.  He explains things until they are crystal clear in layman's terms.  However, the structure of the course was horrific; there was very little guidance.  Also TAs were useless and not helpful.

lectures were very organized. however, lectures, text, tutorial and assignments all seemed as if they weren't related. the assignments were unclear and took a long time to do for a mere 3-4% each. exams were pretty tough; be forewarned! garth seems like a great guy, but the class was horrid! guess thats what happens with its a required course.

Garth is absolutely awesome! made a tough/boring course extremely fun and easy to understand. makes the course practical by giving you tools. his exams are extremely fair b/c all the material is given to you in lecture; you don't need to read...just memorize and understand concepts. i absolutely love him!! really down-to-earth and approachable.

Not a bad guy. Listen to the lectures to study before the midterm - you will do well, for he is VERY clear. He tries to give you your money's worth by recognizing it. My only complaint was that he didn't allow us to email our TA's - which made it impossible to make appointments if u couldn't make it to office hours - Obviously not very helpful.

it's a stats course, what can u expect? he tries his best to make things super clear, he's always full of energy, and actually keeps me awake through the lec. if i were given a choice to take this course again, i would pick him over patric L. he's much better in terms of learning

Does his best to explain everything as comprehensively as possible. Is willing to answer any questions. Quite a lot of work for this class, but he makes sure you learn the material. Midterm was very fair. Paper wasn't bad once the ball's rolling. He's a pretty decent prof if you don't take things too defensively.

The course content is diffcult but he explains it wonderfuly- going through things step by step and anything important he repeats it. The midterm was more than fair- it was exactly what he said was on it (and no he isn't one of those profs who just reads out the title of every chapter and says that is what is on the test)
Best looking prof i've ever had! His good-looks and sense of humour are what keeps me awake in a class I'm forced to take.

I think he's a great prof- never met anyone who encouraged students to really express their opinions- the whole point of the 'university' experience. He takes criticism seriously, is approachable, and best of all- he's a fair marker. his exaims are fair. Anyone who says otherwise shoul to major in communication
made class fun, interesting, great at explaining concepts/ material, very fair, I really enjoyed the class!!!

wicked class but the material tossed at you is lots. Be prepared to work very hard. Lectures are cool but he talks very fast so be ready. Very hard to get an A in this class as you will have to work very hard, but cool class
Lecture & material is extermely interesting.  Exams and paper are exteremely hard though, so you have to work your ass off to get a decent grade.

Garth is a great prof. He only picks on those of us who can take it. All of the negative coments seem to share the same theme, that his classes are too labor intensive. To the detractors I ask, this is supposed to be the best Crim school in the world, what the *&$% did you expect?
No Comments
avoid this guy. he makes the class harder than it should be. he was a waste of my money.

Garth is one of my favourite prof's. His lectures are amazingly clear and he is one of the funniest prof's I have ever had! He is super cool outside of class too, and if you ever need help he is always there!
No Comments

Garth is very knowlegable and intelligent. His teaching methods and organization are his undoing. I have heard many comments in support of Garth in different classes, but avoid taking a research method class with Garth unless you are satisfied with receiving lower marks than you would with a different professor.
One of the best profs ever!  If you find him to be too hard, then maybe you need to rethink Crim as a major.  You'll never find someone who can make the material easier to grasp than him.
good guy. can be tough, though.

Garth has no ability to teach.  He is unable to pass along his knowledge of a subject to his students.  If you do not understand something, you will not get the help needed.  His lectures are disorganized and he tests you on things not taught in lecture or tutorial.  This course is mandatory but do not take it with Garth unless you want to fail.

And on top of that, he took the time to translate 321 as well. Assuming you have done the readings (there are many) he provides a brilliant 'Reader's Digest' version of the course that 'contextualizes' the phil within the methods. Pay attention for the *bonus* 'Garthanisms.'

Simply an incredible professor.  In grad school now and his undergrad courses are some of the most thoughtprovoking I have taken.  His ability to cater his style of lecture to the requestS of students is truly remarkable.  Demands makes of students are refreshing in a dept. that hands out easy a's
WHen you get to know him you will find that he is actually quite shy and doesn't really like public speaking.  He is too nice of a guy...way to nice.  He needs to fail more students.

I signed up for a methods class, what I got was a shotty trip down philosophy lane. The history and philosophical underpinnings are important, but should not constitute the bulk of a research methods class.

BOORRRRRING.  Likes to say "ergo", "part and parcel", and "vis-a-vis" a lot!  Not at all funny, and I need something in a qualitative stats class to keep me going.  Unnecessarily extensive materials/readings.

I say 300 because he compiled the books for the Distance Ed. classes. Garth is a very intellegent individual that can make you think differently about a wide variety of topics. However, he also throws at students a very hard work load. DON'T take two classes with him in one semester. You'll be sorry

This guy can lecture for hours and say nothing. He talks about paradigms and philosophy of research when all we want to know is how to do the damn research. Thank god teh TAs take over lecture sometimes.
He's an excellent professor.  He makes the material simple to understand and exciting to learn.  Definately one of the most dynamic and intersting profs I've had.
He really is a nice guy.  He is a fair marker, and people who fail his class can only blame themselves.
He is always willing to take time out of his day, and stay extra office hours (even during his wife's pregnancy) to help out his students.

Hands down one of THE BEST profs around.  Made Research Methods actually tolerable.  Not only are lectures both dynamic and animated, but his frequent "tongue & cheeky" attitude provides a real flavour.  Oh yes, and he has an insane memory for recalling student's names!

People, if you can stay away from him....DO IT !!! He's so arrogant and marks a two year course very hard. No matter what you put down as an answer, it's not complete. He's going for his ten-year and students have to suffer for it. Thank you very much.

I have had him for both Crim 320 and 321. He makes you work, but he explains things and is willing to help you out. You just have to be willing to work, and suprise, you actually might learn something
He's a washed out cop wannabe. Contradicted himself often on project requirements.  Talks like he's 6'4, but he's barely 5'9.  Smug and arrogant.  I hope he stays sessional.
Garth is one of the worst profs i've ever had.  He's both arrogant and aggressive.
Excellent! Very interesting class! Great Prof!

Garth is an incredible professor.  Sure he may come off a little aggressive in class but outside class he is very helpful and friendly. And while it may seem like a lot of work, I feel incredibly confident in my research abilities thanks to Garth

Garth is great!  He may be aggressive and arrogant in class, but visit him outside of class and he is a great guy.  He is down to earth and has great stories and advice.  I did really well in his class so I have no complaints.
hey buddy take him for crim 321 and see if you still think he is a good prof have fun in that class wink
I thought he was great!  Maybe he's tougher on upper divison classes.. but I really enjoyed his class and I thought he was smart and clear in his lectures.
He is by far one of the worst profs in the crim department
He is very intelligent and a great teacher

I have had Davies for 2 courses and these have been the courses I have hated the most. True, they were both research methods but his personality and workload make it a lot worse than it has to be. 3 friggin research projects for only 20% each sucks!
Good prof but scary personality. The workload is huge. O.k. we students in University courses expect a lot of work but this is nuts! This class should be taken just by itself.
No Comments
No Comments
Certainly has a great knowledge of research methods. However, he fails to understand students have many other classes and commitments (i.e.jobs), as the workload is very strenuous.

Garth, you need to stop being so arrogant and abrasive towards your students.  We are here to learn, not to be ridiculed.  You have so much knowledge, yet your sarcasm detracts from the enjoyment of your class.
insensitive to students' need, good researcher but not good prof.

Davies is an arrogant little man who enjoys to belittle his class and does not seem like he genuinely wants to help his students learn the material. Perhaps it is just the course itself but most students didn't like him either!
